title: Ticket #1755: Have a -strict flag that turns some warnings into fatal errors
description: In the case of a number of warnings, such as the proposed warning for priority categories with no nodes, I think that in many cases users will never notice the warnings, because if the DAG runs they probably won't look at the dagman.out file. So I think it would make sense to have a -strict flag that turns warnings into fatal errors, so that users would be sure to notice them...
remarks:
2011-Apr-26 09:31:26 by wenger:
I started working on this, and one thing I decided partway through is that there should be several levels of strictness. (For the highest level, any warning would become a fatal error, but for lower levels only more "severe" warnings would become fatal errors.)

2011-Jun-01 13:54:49 by nwp:
I reviewed it; The patch looks good. My only question is, "Why is there is not a command-line option, in addition to the config file option?" I also wonder if this could be inserted into a DAG submit file

2011-Jun-01 15:16:47 by wenger:
As far as why no command-line option, there could be one, but with per-DAG config files, I don't really see that much need.

2011-Jun-01 15:32:55 by nwp:
OK. I forgot about per-DAG config files, so that is question is vacuous.
